summary: This document is a chronological log detailing the final days of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, from being placed on suicide watch on July 23, 2019, to his death on August 10, 2019. It records his condition, cellmate status, staff interactions, and the discovery of his body, noting a failure to conduct required checks and the presence of a makeshift noose.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the log; details his placement on suicide watch, removal from watch, activities on the day before his death, and the discovery of his unresponsive body in his cell.

persons.name: Unit Manager
persons.context: Reported giving Epstein a telephone call on the evening of August 9, 2019, and described him as being in good spirits.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: Multiple officers are referenced; one conducted a count where Epstein waved, and two others failed to conduct official counts and refused to discuss the lapse.

connections.description: Epstein shared a cell with this individual from after his removal from suicide watch until the cellmate's release from the institution on August 9, 2019.
Officers were responsible for conducting counts and checks on Epstein; one reported a wave from him, while others failed to perform required checks.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in a fetal position, breathing but unresponsive, with a red neck. He was placed on suicide watch and under medical evaluation.

events.title: Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was removed from suicide watch after daily interactions and returned to the Special Housing Unit with a cellmate.

events.title: Cellmate Released, Epstein Alone
events.description: Epstein's cellmate was released from the institution and did not return. Epstein was in a legal visit all day and returned to an empty cell, despite being on PSYCH Alert requiring a cellmate.

events.title: Evening Phone Call
events.description: The Unit Manager gave Epstein a telephone call in the evening. Epstein was reported to be in good spirits and nothing unusual was noted.

events.title: Failure to Conduct Counts
events.description: One officer reported failing to conduct the 3am and 5am official counts. When asked about 30-minute checks, the officer did not respond. A second officer refused to discuss the matter.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Staff found Epstein unresponsive in his cell during breakfast service. CPR was initiated, and he was transported to the hospital where he was pronounced dead. Bruising was noted on his neck and a makeshift noose was found in the cell.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (implied Special Housing Unit)
Hospital (unnamed, where Epstein was pronounced dead)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, and was pronounced dead at the hospital.
Epstein had been placed on suicide watch on July 23, 2019, after being found in a fetal position with a red neck, but was removed from watch on July 29, 2019.
On the night before his death, Epstein was left without a cellmate, violating the PSYCH Alert protocol that required one.
Correctional officers failed to conduct mandatory 3am and 5am counts on Epstein the night he died, and one refused to discuss the lapse.
Upon discovery of Epstein's body, institution medical staff reported bruising around his neck and an orange makeshift noose was found in the cell.
